meanings.definition: Not able to be learned or acquired.
meanings.sent1: The complex math problem was unlearnable for the young students.
meanings.sent2: The new language was unlearnable for me, but I tried my best.
meanings.sent3: The idea of flying without wings seemed unlearnable, but it was just a dream.
meanings.sent4: Her unlearnable talent for painting brought life to the dull canvas.
meanings.sent5: The unlearnable skill of juggling fire sticks amazed the audience.

meanings.sent1: The unforgettable memory was unlearnable, no matter how hard he tried.
meanings.sent2: The fear of spiders was unlearnable for her, even after therapy.
meanings.sent3: His unlearnable habit of biting his nails made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The unlearnable trauma haunted her dreams every night.
meanings.sent5: The unlearnable smell of fresh cookies brought back happy memories.
